name: Cold Email Offer & Copy Principles
description: Core principles for crafting cold emails that convert, including offer structure, lead magnets, and mechanism-based selling

serviceVsOffer.description: The critical difference between a service and an offer

bad.problem: Just a service category, not an offer
Tells them your job title, not what happens when they hire you

good.offer: 5 qualified calls in 30 days or you don't pay
We build cold email systems that book 15-30 qualified calls per month
We redesign websites that convert 2-3x more visitors into leads
We get B2B companies ranking on page 1 for their highest-intent keywords in 90 days
10 qualified + attending sales calls in 30 days like we've done for 72 other paid ad agencies or you don't pay

coldOfferFormula.description: The 5-part formula that makes cold emails work

elements.name: Mechanism
elements.description: HOW you deliver the result - this is what makes it believable
examples: by using Clay to target companies hiring SDRs
by building 20 high-authority backlinks per month

elements.name: Proof
elements.description: Who else have you helped? Similar to them.
examples: like we've done for 72 other paid ad agencies
helped [Similar Company] go from 0 to 30 calls/month
took an SEO agency from 100% referrals to 12 calls/week

elements.name: Risk Reversal
elements.description: What happens if it doesn't work?
examples: or we work for free until we hit it

mechanismPrinciple.description: Cold traffic does NOT believe the result until they understand the METHOD
mechanismPrinciple.rule: Always share HOW you do it, not just WHAT you deliver

bad: We help you scale with AI
good: We book meetings by using Clay to target companies hiring SDRs
We build a custom lead magnet, drive traffic through cold email, and nurture replies through a 5-touch sequence
We run a full technical audit, fix your site structure, then build 20 high-authority backlinks per month
Our AI agent calls 100 leads daily and transfers the live answers to your reps

frontEndVsBackEnd.description: Two types of offers for different stages of trust

frontEnd.purpose: Get the call - designed for cold traffic who don't trust you yet
examples: We'll show you exactly how to find companies not running ads right now but who have budget plus we'll give you a 1K list when you book a 30-min walkthrough
Report on 5 things competitors are doing to steal your leads
See your competitors' live ads + their estimated spend

backEnd.purpose: Close the sale - where you make the real money
examples: We'll book you 10 qualified calls per month for $3K/month

frontEndVsBackEnd.strategy: Front-end offers get the call. Back-end offers close the sale on the call.

sixQuestionFramework.description: Answer these before writing any cold email

questions.question: What do we do?
questions.good: Specific outcome like 'We get B2B companies ranking on page 1 in 90 days'

questions.question: Who is it for?
questions.good: Specific like 'Marketing agencies doing 50-200K/month who want to add outbound'
questions.template: We work with [specific type] who [specific situation/pain]

questions.question: How do we do it?
questions.bad: Just the result like 'We get you leads'
questions.good: The mechanism like 'Custom targeting + personalized sequences + done-for-you management'
questions.template: The way we do this is [step 1], then [step 2], then [step 3]

questions.question: What problems do we solve?
questions.good: Their actual pain in their words - pipeline inconsistency, relying on referrals, tried outbound and failed
questions.template: List 3-5 problems your ideal client actually complains about

questions.question: Who else have we helped?
questions.good: Specific like 'Helped [Similar Company] go from 0 to 30 calls/month in 60 days'
questions.template: Include who they were, where they started, what happened, how fast

questions.question: What's the ROI/benefit?
questions.good: Specific like 'You won't have to rely on just inbound or referrals again'
questions.template: If you pay us [X], you'll get [Y], which means [Z return]

coldTrafficReality.description: Understanding why cold prospects don't respond
facts: A cold prospect has no relationship with you
A cold prospect has no belief you can help
A cold prospect has no evidence you've helped others
A cold prospect has no understanding of your process
coldTrafficReality.solution: Your email has to address these points through mechanism, proof, and low-friction offers

information.example: Report on 5 things competitors are doing to steal your leads

twoTypesOfOffers.rule: If you can't sell the result, sell the information
